roleset.name: have a suspicion about something

role.descr: suspect; entity inspring suspicion in arg0

example.name: just transitive
example.text: Mark Shepperd, an analyst at UBS Phillips & Drew in London, said, ``I suspect (the departure) will be fairly irrelevant for the company.
example.arg: (the departure) will be fairly irrelevant for the company

example.name: passive extraction
example.text: [Those employees]-1 are suspected *trace*-1 of illegally gaining an estimated $376.8 million, the prosecutor was quoted as saying by the Excelsior news service.
example.arg: of illegally gaining an estimated $376.8 million

example.name: another prepositional example
example.text: Mary suspects nothing but evil intentions of John.

example.name: adjectival rel: suspicious
example.text: It would have to be explained in great predictive detail for me to consider it , and even then I would be highly suspicious .

example.name: adjectival rel: suspicious; arg2 as subject
example.text: I'll be honest, though: overly perfect-looking food is suspicious to me.
example.note: The subject is arg2 rather than arg1 because it is inspiring suspicion.

example.name: adjectival rel: suspicious; args 1, 2, common in medical
example.text: This is suspicious for a renal cell carcinoma .

roleset.note: Frames file for 'suspect' based on financial subcorpus; adjectival 'suspicious' based on BOLT-4,5, medi-seedcorpus. Member of VNcls conjecture-29.5-1, consider-29.9-2, suspect-81.
